Authors:
Nimali Indeewari de Silva, Kasun Madhusanka Thambugala,
Danushka Sandaruwan Tennakoon, Rungtiwa Phookamsak, Ruvishika Shehali
Jayawardena, Saisamorn Lumyong, Kevin Hyde
Title:
Nigrograna species from Magnolia forest plants in Yunnan,
China
Keywords:
1 new taxa  Dothideomycetes  Nigrogranaceae  Pleosporales 
Taxonomy
Abstract:
Nigrograna is an ecologically diverse group of fungi
exhibiting as saprobic, endophytic, fungicolous in plant hosts and as a
human pathogen. Nigrograna magnoliae sp. nov. and a new host record of
N. thymi collected from dead twigs of Magnolia grandiflora in Yunnan,
China are described and illustrated. The partial 28S large subunits of
the nuclear ribosomal RNA genes (LSU), the partial 18S small subunit
nuclear rDNA (SSU), the internal transcribed spacers (ITS) and the
translation elongation factor-1α (tef1) sequence data were analyzed to
establish the phylogenetic placements of these species in the family
Nigrogranaceae.
